content:
• Monday, February 27, 2012
  • GSK

    More on Human Genome Sciences (HGSI): Q4 beats estimates across the board. Revenue jumped 113%...

    More on Human Genome Sciences (HGSI): Q4 beats estimates across the board. Revenue jumped 113% Y/Y on strong sales of Benlysta and lower R&D expenses. Shares +2.7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:06 PM
  • LUFK

    Lufkin Industries (NASDAQ:LUFK) -1.4% AH after announcing it's spending $126.6M to acquire...

    Lufkin Industries (NASDAQ:LUFK) -1.4% AH after announcing it's spending $126.6M to acquire U.K.-based Zenith Oilfield Technology, a provider of products for monitoring and analyzing oil well data. Lufkin, which says Zenith's products complement its existing monitoring and analysis tools, will pay for the acquisition by issuing 2.5M shares, good for proceeds of $208M based on today's close.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:48 PM
  • RPRX

    Repros Therapeutics (NASDAQ:RPRX) says the FDA has granted a meeting with the company to discuss...

    Repros Therapeutics (NASDAQ:RPRX) says the FDA has granted a meeting with the company to discuss the design of its Phase 3 studies for Androxal, as well as the components of the overall drug development program required for NDA submission. Shares +2.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • ERT

    More on eResearch Technology's (NASDAQ:ERT) Q4: Bookings for the quarter were $82.5M, a new high...

    More on eResearch Technology's (NASDAQ:ERT) Q4: Bookings for the quarter were $82.5M, a new high and well above revenue of $52.3M. As a result, eResearch's total backlog grew 4% Q/Q to $357.4M. The company expects Q1 revenue of $46M-$49M and EPS of $0.08-$0.11 (consensus of $44.7M and $0.10), and 2012 revenue of $195M-$203M and EPS of $0.45-$0.53 (consensus of $195.2M and $0.46). ERT +15.7% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:27 PM
  • ZAGG

    More on Zagg's (NASDAQ:ZAGG) Q4: In addition to beating estimates, the mobile accessory maker is...

    More on Zagg's (NASDAQ:ZAGG) Q4: In addition to beating estimates, the mobile accessory maker is guiding for 2012 revenue of $250M, up 40% Y/Y and above a consensus of $240.6M. It expects adjusted EBITDA of $55M-$60M, up from 2011's $45.3M. Zagg's Q4 gross margin was 46%, up 400 bps Q/Q. ZAGG +6.2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:15 PM
  • PEIX

    Pacific Ethanol (NASDAQ:PEIX) tanks after hours as its Q4 comes up shy of estimates. Net sales...

    Pacific Ethanol (NASDAQ:PEIX) tanks after hours as its Q4 comes up shy of estimates. Net sales came in at $241.8M, up 80% from $134.2M in the year-ago period. Net losses for the period were $2.4M compared to net loss of $12.1M last year. The company also sees a 5% slowdown in industry output, and says it has cut back at its own plants a bit more than that. Shares -22% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:01 PM
  • OKE

    Oneok Partners (OKS), which made a new closing high today, falls 3.6% AH after announcing public...

    Oneok Partners (OKS), which made a new closing high today, falls 3.6% AH after announcing public and private stock offerings of 7M shares apiece, good for proceeds of $856.8M based on today's close. Oneok (NYSE:OKE), which currently owns 42.8% of OKS, will be the sole buyer for the private offering. Oneok Partners says it will partly use the offering proceeds to pay down debt.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM | 3 Comments
  • IPGP

    IPG Photonics (NASDAQ:IPGP) -2.9% AH after announcing a 3M share stock offering; 2.8M shares...

    IPG Photonics (NASDAQ:IPGP) -2.9% AH after announcing a 3M share stock offering; 2.8M shares will be issued by the company (good for proceeds of $160M based on today's close), and another 200K will be sold by CEO Valentin Gapontsev. The company only says it will use the proceeds from new shares for general corporate purposes. SA's Jae Jun offered a positive take on IPG earlier today.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:24 PM
  • CHMT

    Chemtura (NYSE:CHMT): Q4 EPS of $0.34 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.11. Revenue of...

    Chemtura (NYSE:CHMT): Q4 EPS of $0.34 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.11. Revenue of $677M (-0.4% Y/Y) misses by $45M. Shares +2.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:13 PM
  • VNET

    21Vianet Group (NASDAQ:VNET): Q4 EPS of $0.12 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $50.6M (+61% Y/Y)....

    21Vianet Group (NASDAQ:VNET): Q4 EPS of $0.12 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $50.6M (+61% Y/Y). Shares +8.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM
  • WCN

    Waste Connections (NYSE:WCN) -2.8% AH after announcing a 12M share stock offering, good for...

    Waste Connections (NYSE:WCN) -2.8% AH after announcing a 12M share stock offering, good for proceeds of $381.8M based on today's close. The company plans to partly use the proceeds to "repay the unhedged portion" of borrowings made under an existing credit facility.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM
  • RWT

    Redwood Trust (NYSE:RWT): Q4 EPS of -$0.03 misses by $0.20. Shares -1.8% AH. (PR)

    Redwood Trust (NYSE:RWT): Q4 EPS of -$0.03 misses by $0.20. Shares -1.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM
  • SINA

    More on Sina's (NASDAQ:SINA) Q4: The company is guiding for Q1 revenue of $101M-$104M, below a...

    More on Sina's (NASDAQ:SINA) Q4: The company is guiding for Q1 revenue of $101M-$104M, below a Street estimate of $113.7M. Advertising revenue +26% Y/Y to $103.7M, but mobile revenue only +1% to $21.3M. R&D expenses +120% Y/Y to $21.6M, and sales & marketing expenses +78% to $36M. Both figures easily outpaced revenue growth of 23%, and reflect Sina's growing investments in Weibo. SINA -4.5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM
  • ENOC

    EnerNOC (NASDAQ:ENOC): Q4 EPS of -$0.91 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $26.8M (+18.1% Y/Y) misses by...

    EnerNOC (NASDAQ:ENOC): Q4 EPS of -$0.91 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $26.8M (+18.1% Y/Y) misses by $1.6M. Shares -2.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM
  • ZAGG

    Zagg (NASDAQ:ZAGG): Q4 EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $67.5M (+130% Y/Y) beats by...

    Zagg (NASDAQ:ZAGG): Q4 EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $67.5M (+130% Y/Y) beats by $3.5M. Shares +8.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM | 2 Comments
  • ERT

    eResearch Technology (NASDAQ:ERT): Q4 EPS of $0.14 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $52.3M (+8.7% Y/Y)...

    eResearch Technology (NASDAQ:ERT): Q4 EPS of $0.14 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $52.3M (+8.7% Y/Y) beats by $5M. Shares +18.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • JAZZ

    Jazz Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:JAZZ): Q4 EPS of $1.17 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $83.5M (+56.4%...

    Jazz Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:JAZZ): Q4 EPS of $1.17 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $83.5M (+56.4% Y/Y) beats by $3M. Shares +2.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • BKNG

    Priceline.com (PCLN): Q4 EPS of $5.37 beats by $0.33. Revenue of $991M (+35.6% Y/Y) beats by...

    Priceline.com (PCLN): Q4 EPS of $5.37 beats by $0.33. Revenue of $991M (+35.6% Y/Y) beats by $23M. Shares +4.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • MVIS

    Microvision (MVIS -15.8%) takes a hit today after its Q4 results disappointed earlier. Losses...

    Microvision (MVIS -15.8%) takes a hit today after its Q4 results disappointed earlier. Losses narrowed less than expected as the maker of display technology platforms reported revenue growth that fell short of Street estimates.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • BAC

    Bank of America's (BAC +2%) proposed $8.5B settlement with investors in mortgage-backed...

    Bank of America's (BAC +2%) proposed $8.5B settlement with investors in mortgage-backed securities should be returned to New York state court for review, a U.S. appeals court rules. The decision is a win for BofA, which seeks approval to settle claims by investors in 530 mortgage securitization trusts with $174B of unpaid principal.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 4 Comments
  • NIHD

    NII Holdings (NIHD -4.4%) is downgraded to Underweight with a new $22 price target from $35 at...

    NII Holdings (NIHD -4.4%) is downgraded to Underweight with a new $22 price target from $35 at Barclays, which believes negative news related to the weak operating performance is mostly priced in but sees no catalysts in the next six to nine months. The firm also says "significant deterioration" in results could continue in coming quarters, adding to potential downside.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • FN

    Fabrinet (FN +1.1%) gets a boost out of Piper Jaffray today, saying the stock is a buy a current...

    Fabrinet (FN +1.1%) gets a boost out of Piper Jaffray today, saying the stock is a buy a current levels. Piper notes the quarter is tracking ahead of company guidance and it has "high conviction" in its Overweight rating and $22 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM

  • Oil cracks, sliding sharply in the past few minutes after hanging on just slightly down for most...

    Oil cracks, sliding sharply in the past few minutes after hanging on just slightly down for most of the day. April WTI Crude -2.1% to $107.48 after flirting with $110 overnight.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • TESO

    Tesco (TESO +3.8%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Buy from Neutral at Pritchard, citing...

    Tesco (TESO +3.8%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Buy from Neutral at Pritchard, citing expectations for a rebound in the company's topdrive business. The firm also ups its price target to $22 from $15.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • CCOI

    Cogent Communications (CCOI +4.9%) moves up after Raymond James ups the shares to Outperform,...

    Cogent Communications (CCOI +4.9%) moves up after Raymond James ups the shares to Outperform, citing the company's compelling free cash flow growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM
  • RIG

    Transocean's (RIG +5.2%) shares surge as investors like the decision to book $1B in estimated...

    Transocean's (RIG +5.2%) shares surge as investors like the decision to book $1B in estimated losses related to the 2010 Deepwater Horizon oil spill. Barclays analysts say the market had expected a charge closer to $3B; results provide hope that "a new era is just over the horizon," Bernstein says. RIG's Q4 loss widened sharply due to the higher charges.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • CCL

    Shares of Carnival (CCL -0.3%) recover and even pass into positive territory briefly after more...

    Shares of Carnival (CCL -0.3%) recover and even pass into positive territory briefly after more details emerge about its cruise ship adrift in the Indian Ocean. The good news: An onboard fire was quickly put out and a rescue mission is ongoing. The less-than-ideal news: The ship is without propulsion in a region known to suffer from attacks by Somali pirates.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • AFFY

    Affymax (OTC:AFFY +3.1%) catches a bid after stating it will receive a $5M milestone payment...

    Affymax (OTC:AFFY +3.1%) catches a bid after stating it will receive a $5M milestone payment from Takeda Pharmaceutical related to the development of its Peginesatide drug for treating anemia in dialysis patients, following the acceptance of a marketing application by Euro regulators. Affymax shot higher in December after an FDA advisory panel recommended Peginesatide be approved.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • KWK

    Quicksilver Resources (KWK -5%) takes a hit after its Q4 misses EPS estimates earlier today....

    Quicksilver Resources (KWK -5%) takes a hit after its Q4 misses EPS estimates earlier today. Earnings fell 85% Y/Y as lower natural-gas prices weighed heavily on production revenue. The company also says it expects FY production volumes to be essentially flat to 2011 volumes.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • BHGE

    Raymond James says the slowdown in the pressure pumping market is "unraveling faster than we...

    Raymond James says the slowdown in the pressure pumping market is "unraveling faster than we thought," prompting it to cut stock ratings for Baker Hughes (BHI -2.4%) and Halliburton (HAL -1.4%). The gap between oil and natural gas prices is attracting capital spending away from gas, where BHI and HAL are strong, so the firm "meaningfully" lowers Q1 margin estimates for large providers.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • MRVL

    Cavium (CAVM +7.1%) spikes after announcing HTC will use the chipmaker's PureVu video processor...

    Cavium (CAVM +7.1%) spikes after announcing HTC will use the chipmaker's PureVu video processor in its Media Link HD TV adapter. The news has compelled Morgan Stanley to declare Cavium a 60-day research tactical idea, arguing the design win - the first for PureVu with a mobile device OEM - will be a positive catalyst, and speculating similar announcements could arrive over the next several weeks.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • RLGT

    Radiant Logistics (RLGT +4%) moves up after issuing a 2013 revenue outlook that topped analyst...

    Radiant Logistics (RLGT +4%) moves up after issuing a 2013 revenue outlook that topped analyst expectations. The logistics provider also says it has acquired privately-held domestic and international transportation services firm ALBS Logistics.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM
  • NOK

    Nokia's (NOK -6.7%) new additions to its phone portfolio revealed at the Mobile World Congress...

    Nokia's (NOK -6.7%) new additions to its phone portfolio revealed at the Mobile World Congress fail to inspire, after setting expectations high last Friday that it would release some "significant industry news." "We were looking for a cheap Windows phone at $200 on a new version of the software," Nomura says. "We got a phone at $260 on the old software." (also: I, II)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • BAXS

    TranS1 (TSON +13.3%) jumps after Canaccord raises the shares to Buy, saying management's recent...

    TranS1 (TSON +13.3%) jumps after Canaccord raises the shares to Buy, saying management's recent actions to re-initiate enrollment in a prospective trial as well as undertaking new physician education programs reflects the company's confidence in its current strategy to drive reimbursement at both the federal and private payor levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM
  • WLK

    Westlake Chemical (WLK +6.6%) trades higher after Goldman ups the shares to Conviction Buy,...

    Westlake Chemical (WLK +6.6%) trades higher after Goldman ups the shares to Conviction Buy, noting the record-high oil-to-methane-ratio significantly benefits the company's US-based ethane-fed ethylene crackers.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM
  • BHC

    Valeant (VRX +6.3%) shares enjoy a boost after the Canadian drug maker posted Q4 EPS of $0.18...

    Valeant (VRX +6.3%) shares enjoy a boost after the Canadian drug maker posted Q4 EPS of $0.18 vs. a loss of $0.10 a year earlier, and adjusted EPS of $0.94 beat expectations. Revenue jumped 34%, which the company attributes to acquisitions and better sales of key dermatology products. VRX also backs earlier guidance for 2012 EPS of $3.95-$4.20.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM
  • ALIM

    Microcaps Alimera Sciences (ALIM +32.1%) and pSivida (PSDV +21.8%) soar off of speculation that...

    Microcaps Alimera Sciences (ALIM +32.1%) and pSivida (PSDV +21.8%) soar off of speculation that the EU will grant approval for eye disease drug Iluvien.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • LHO

    LaSalle Hotel (LHO +1.6%) moves higher on an upgrade to Outperform on valuation at Wells Fargo...

    LaSalle Hotel (LHO +1.6%) moves higher on an upgrade to Outperform on valuation at Wells Fargo with a $27.50-$30 price target range, citing upside potential stemming from the hotel's recent renovations.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM
  • WHR

    Whirlpool (WHR +6.1%) posts a healthy gain after the NAR's rosier-than-expected pending home...

    Whirlpool (WHR +6.1%) posts a healthy gain after the NAR's rosier-than-expected pending home sales report bodes well for a pick up in appliance purchasing in the near future by U.S. households.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM
  • PROJ

    Shares of Deltek (PROJ +8.3%) shoot higher on volume 3X normal trading volume after one of its...

    Shares of Deltek (PROJ +8.3%) shoot higher on volume 3X normal trading volume after one of its execs pens an article in the Washington Post highlighting the government's reliance on Multiple Award Task Order-based Contracts (MATOCs).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM
  • ANIP

    Biotech analyst Adam Feuerstein doesn't pull any punches as he takes in with a jaundiced eye the...

    Biotech analyst Adam Feuerstein doesn't pull any punches as he takes in with a jaundiced eye the 26.4% runup in shares of BioSante Pharmaceuticals (BPAX) off of its announcement of a positive test for its Pancreas cancer vaccine. "BPAX is a total failure at drug development but does a superb job writing fantastically promotional PR headlines."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • NFLX

    A leveling out in subscriber additions and competition driving up content costs are the reasons...

    A leveling out in subscriber additions and competition driving up content costs are the reasons behind Aaron Kessler's downgrade earlier of Netflix (NFLX -2.9%). Kessler notes Google searches for "Netflix" - after rising sharply for years - have shown no Y/Y growth in 2012 Q1.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM | 1 Comment
  • DRQ

    Dril-Quip (DRQ -3.8%) shares sink after the drilling equipment maker issues a downbeat 2012...

    Dril-Quip (DRQ -3.8%) shares sink after the drilling equipment maker issues a downbeat 2012 earnings outlook that overshadows a strong Q4 performance as offshore drilling activity continues to improve. DRQ sees EPS rising to $2.60-$2.80 this year, well below the $3.20 consensus view.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • JOY

    Joy Global (JOY +0.8%) ticks higher on positive comments out of BMO Capital this morning, saying...

    Joy Global (JOY +0.8%) ticks higher on positive comments out of BMO Capital this morning, saying it expects the company to benefit from healthy equipment demand and and beat Q1 estimates.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • OSIS

    OSI Systems (OSIS +9.4%) says Mexico's tax and customs authority has exercised options that...

    OSI Systems (OSIS +9.4%) says Mexico's tax and customs authority has exercised options that bring the total value of their six-year turnkey screening services agreement to ~$900M. The specialized electronics and services provider had previously announced a minimum obligated value of $400M for the program.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • CROX

    Crocs (CROX +2.9%) expects to double sales in less than 5 years, according to CEO John McCarvel....

    Crocs (CROX +2.9%) expects to double sales in less than 5 years, according to CEO John McCarvel. He notes that the key to the firm's growth will be Asia - which is slated to soon pass the combined Americas in sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • ANRZQ

    Alpha Natural Resources (ANR -2.3%) trades lower after Moody's cut its rating outlook to...

    Alpha Natural Resources (ANR -2.3%) trades lower after Moody's cut its rating outlook to negative from stable, noting the coal supplier's operating performance has weakened at a time of industry-wide challenges.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • MHGC

    Morgans Hotel (MHGC -3.3%) dips after being cut to Market Perform at JMP Securities, saying that...

    Morgans Hotel (MHGC -3.3%) dips after being cut to Market Perform at JMP Securities, saying that renovations at its Hudson hotel and its strategic repositioning are going to be a drag on earnings.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • DNDN

    In spite of beating Q4 estimates, Dendreon (DNDN -16.4%) is tanking in early trading. A possible...

    In spite of beating Q4 estimates, Dendreon (DNDN -16.4%) is tanking in early trading. A possible culprit is the company's guidance for a Q1 sales decline, though Street estimates had already forecast a sales drop.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM | 1 Comment
  • IPG

    Interpublic Group (IPG +1.2%) moves higher on an upgrade to Buy at Deutsche on the back of the...

    Interpublic Group (IPG +1.2%) moves higher on an upgrade to Buy at Deutsche on the back of the company's solid Q4 results and guidance. The firm also raises its price target to $15 from $10.50.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • CCL

    Carnival (CCL -1.8%) trades lower on more negative stories swirling around concerning its cruise...

    Carnival (CCL -1.8%) trades lower on more negative stories swirling around concerning its cruise lines. The company reportedly has a ship adrift off the coast of Tanzania following a fire and saw 22 customers robbed at gunpoint in Mexico last week after stopping off from a cruise that originated from California.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM
  • INVN

    Motion sensor developer InvenSense (INVN -11%) dives after filing to sell $110M in shares held...

    Motion sensor developer InvenSense (INVN -11%) dives after filing to sell $110M in shares held by insiders, and providing FY13 guidance. While reiterating its FQ4 (ends in March) guidance, InvenSense says it expects FQ1 revenue of $38M-$42M and FY13 revenue growth of 40%-50%, below consensus estimates of $42.6M and 51% growth, respectively. InvenSense went public in November.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM | 1 Comment
  • ATPAQ

    Shares of ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG +15.7%) kick up a gain after the company announces its early...

    Shares of ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG +15.7%) kick up a gain after the company announces its early production at a deepwater well met expectations and that the rate of oil production will be increased.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM | 2 Comments
  • FSLR

    Cowen expects that Germany's plans to accelerate and deepen FIT cuts will result in further...

    Cowen expects that Germany's plans to accelerate and deepen FIT cuts will result in further industry ASP pressures. As a result, the firm cuts a number of solar names: First Solar (FSLR -1.4%), SunPower (SPWR -5.3%), Suntech (STP +1.3%), and Trina Solar (TSL -3.3) are all downgraded to Neutral from Outperform.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM | 1 Comment
  • S

    Sprint's (S -2.4%) 11th-hour decision to walk away from an $8B deal for MetroPCS (PCS -0.4%)...

    Sprint's (S -2.4%) 11th-hour decision to walk away from an $8B deal for MetroPCS (PCS -0.4%) prompts questions about its leadership and who's calling the shots. A deal "which may have cut equity holders’ stakes in half to get larger in the prepaid business seems a bit incongruent with the strategic direction,” Nomura says. As for PCS, other suitors could present themselves in the near future.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM
  • CHTP

    Chelsea Therapeutics (CHTP +8.8%) continues its meteoric rise after Thursday's news that an FDA...

    Chelsea Therapeutics (CHTP +8.8%) continues its meteoric rise after Thursday's news that an FDA advisory panel recommended approval of its Northera drug for treatment of symptomatic neurogenic orthostatic hypotension in patients with primary autonomic failure, such as Parkinson’s disease. Shares are up ~76% since the announcement.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • LOW

    Credit Suisse analyst Gary Balter keeps a bullish long-term view on both Lowe's (LOW +1.6%) and...

    Credit Suisse analyst Gary Balter keeps a bullish long-term view on both Lowe's (LOW +1.6%) and Home Depot (HD -0.3%) with Buy ratings after the chains benefited (earnings beats: I, II) from homeowners taking up spring projects early due to the mild winter. "We encourage investors to look past the near term and think about double-digit margins for all when housing recovers."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • ARBA

    Ariba (NASDAQ:ARBA) opens +3.3% after shares are upgraded to Conviction Buy from Neutral at...

    Ariba (NASDAQ:ARBA) opens +3.3% after shares are upgraded to Conviction Buy from Neutral at Goldman Sachs, which cites improving fundamentals with increased adoption of B2B connectivity and SaaS, accelerated growth and margin expansion, and increased likelihood of M&A. The firm sets a new $40 price target, up from $34.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:33 AM
  • ESRX

    Express Scripts (NASDAQ:ESRX) moves up 3.5% premarket and Medco Health (NYSE:MHS) gains 4.9% off...

    Express Scripts (NASDAQ:ESRX) moves up 3.5% premarket and Medco Health (NYSE:MHS) gains 4.9% off of a report that FTC lawyers have backed the merger between the two companies.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM | 2 Comments
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX -2.8%) falls premarket as Raymond James downgrades the stock to "underperform"...

    Netflix (NFLX -2.8%) falls premarket as Raymond James downgrades the stock to "underperform" from "market perform." Details to follow.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM
  • MU

    Micron (NASDAQ:MU) +5.4% premarket after Japan-based DRAM maker Elpida files for bankruptcy...

    Micron (NASDAQ:MU) +5.4% premarket after Japan-based DRAM maker Elpida files for bankruptcy protection. Elpida is expected to continue producing chips, at least for now, but the move should help other DRAM makers, including Micron, Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) and Hynix (OTC:HXSCF).

     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM
  • FBC

    Flagstar Bancorp (NYSE:FBC) -9.3% premarket after agreeing to pay up to $132.8M to settle civil...

    Flagstar Bancorp (NYSE:FBC) -9.3% premarket after agreeing to pay up to $132.8M to settle civil fraud charges that accused the bank of improperly approving loans for government insurance.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:03 AM
  • PEIX

    Pacific Ethanol (NASDAQ:PEIX) gains 5.4% in premarket trading in advance of the release of its...

    Pacific Ethanol (NASDAQ:PEIX) gains 5.4% in premarket trading in advance of the release of its earnings report due to be released after the market closes. SA author Brian Nichols identifies the biotech company as one of his hot plays to soar this week off of strong revenue growth and improved guidance for FY12.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:50 AM
  • TBET
